com.conceptwave.scripting
Class CwfError

com.conceptwave.scripting.Object
  com.conceptwave.scripting.CWScriptable
      com.conceptwave.scripting.CwfError

public class CwfError
extends CWScriptable

Script exception class. The exceptions are identified by their code which should match a string message in the application resources. The string may contain place holders for message parameters. The exception code have structure AS####. 'A' is a letter that identifies the application (the best is to use letter A). ConceptWave reserves the letters D,J,P and U for internal messages. 'S' is a letter which defines the exception severity level as follows: I - information, W - warning, E - error, F - fatal error. Exceptions that are not information or warning are considered errors. '####' represents a 4 digit number with leading zeroes from 0000 to 9999. The message parameters place holders in the message text have format {n} where n is the parameter number starting from 0.

Method Detail

log

public static java.lang.Long log(com.conceptwave.scripting.Object err,
                                 String code,
                                 com.conceptwave.scripting.Object[] param1,
                                 com.conceptwave.scripting.Object param2,
                                 String objectId)
Logs an error. Returns the numeric id of the recorded error in the system log table.

Parameters:
err - Optional exception object. May be null
code - Optional message text resource code. May be null
param1 - Optional message parameter 1. Can be array or simple object. Any interpreter object is allowed. May be null
param2 - Deprecated message parameter 2 (ignored if param1 is an array with more than one element). Any simple interpreter object is allowed. May be null or can be omitted
objectId - Deprecated object ID. May be null or can be omitted
Returns:
int the numeric id of the recorded error in the system log table.
